citations.narrative:
Six puppies were in an enclosure that measured 44.25 inches by 72 inches for a total of 3,186 square inches of space.
The six puppies measured 19 inches, 20 inches, 20 inches, 21 inches, 21 inches, and 23 inches respectively. Together
these six puppies required 4,276 square inches of space. The enclosure they were in was short by 1,090 square inches
of space.
Cage space requirements ensure that the dogs have enough room to move about freely within their enclosures. It
minimizes the dogs from stepping or sitting in their feces or urine and also minimizes the spread of disease. The licensee
must ensure that all enclosures containing dogs and puppies have enough floor space to meet the minimum floor space
requirements for the number of and the size of the dogs in that enclosure.
Correct starting on 4/6/23.

A complete physical exam from head to tail for each dog has not been completed by the Attending Veterinarian since
December 2021. Not having the Attending Veterinarian conduct complete physical exams on all dogs at least once every
12 months doesn't ensure the dogs are being adequately evaluated for health care issues. The Attending Veterinarian
must conduct a physical examination of each dog in the kennel. Correcty by 5/6/23.

The licensee stated he vaccinated all adult dogs for distemper and parvo in September of 2022, but he has no
documentation showing that. In addition, he believes most of the adult dogs have been vaccinated for rabies, but was
unable to find any certificates or documentation showing when they had been vaccinated. Not keeping proper medical
records showing documentation of which vaccines were given and the dates they were given doesn't ensure the dogs are
properly protected against the various diseases those vaccines are supposed to protect against. The licensee must keep
records showing the vaccine type that was given and the date it was given for all dogs in the kennel. Correct starting on
4/6/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End of report.
End Section

narrative:
3.6(c)(1)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Six puppies were in an enclosure that measured 44.25 inches by 72 inches for a total of 3,186 square inches of space.  
The six puppies measured 19 inches, 20 inches, 20 inches, 21 inches, 21 inches, and 23 inches respectively.  Together 
these six puppies required 4,276 square inches of space.  The enclosure they were in was short by 1,090 square inches 
of space. 
 
Cage space requirements ensure that the dogs have enough room to move about freely within their enclosures.  It 
minimizes the dogs from stepping or sitting in their feces or urine and also minimizes the spread of disease.  The licensee 
must ensure that all enclosures containing dogs and puppies have enough floor space to meet the minimum floor space 
requirements for the number of and the size of the dogs in that enclosure. 
 
Correct starting on 4/6/23. 
3.13(a)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
A complete physical exam from head to tail for each dog has not been completed by the Attending Veterinarian since 
December 2021.  Not having the Attending Veterinarian conduct complete physical exams on all dogs at least once every

12 months doesn't ensure the dogs are being adequately evaluated for health care issues.  The Attending Veterinarian 
must conduct a physical examination of each dog in the kennel.  Correcty by 5/6/23. 
3.13(b)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee stated he vaccinated all adult dogs for distemper and parvo in September of 2022, but he has no 
documentation showing that.  In addition, he believes most of the adult dogs have been vaccinated for rabies, but was 
unable to find any certificates or documentation showing when they had been vaccinated.  Not keeping proper medical 
records showing documentation of which vaccines were given and the dates they were given doesn't ensure the dogs are 
properly protected against the various diseases those vaccines are supposed to protect against.  The licensee must keep 
records showing the vaccine type that was given and the date it was given for all dogs in the kennel.  Correct starting on 
4/6/23. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End of report. 
 
End Section
